column1: theliberaltony 161035764494 "2017-05-24 22:31:56 GMT" http://theliberaltony.tumblr.com/post/161035764494/fact-of-the-day "resistdrumpf: Legalizing weed could save the federal government approx. $7.7 billion annually by not having to enforce the current prohibition on the drug. Legalization would also net an additional $6 billion per year if the government taxed it at rates similar to alcohol and tobacco. That’s as much as +$13.7 billion per year.[Source]" False text

theliberaltony 161035382783 "2017-05-24 22:19:24 GMT" http://theliberaltony.tumblr.com/post/161035382783/occupythedisco-its-wild-how-you-need-a-job-to "occupythedisco: It’s wild how you need a job to survive but not all jobs pay enough to live on and it’s not always possible to get a job when you need one
column2: so people are literally just dying due to factors outside of their control and we’re all like “this is fine.”" False text

column1: theliberaltony 161033364486 "2017-05-24 21:14:21 GMT" http://theliberaltony.tumblr.com/post/161033364486/odinsblog-psa-social-security-disability "odinsblog:  PSA: Social Security Disability Insurance IS Social Security. So don’t fall for the okie doke when Republicans try to present it like its not. There isn’t a “good” Social Security and a “bad” one. It’s all the same thing
column2: despite whatever clever lie Republicans might concoct.  So when Donald Trump promised not to make any cuts to Social Security
column4: I know—because Social Security Disability is a very big part of Social Security. It’s the same program. Paul Ryan would have been a homeless and destitute child if the government didn’t give his father’s SSDI to him and his mother after his father died. (and yeah
column5: I hate Paul Ryan as much as the next guy
column6: but millions of children face the same circumstances he did
column7: and they don’t deserve any cuts to SSDI) Social Security is not some unearned “entitlement” that the government is “giving” away to undeserving lazy people either. It’s not a government handout. It’s yours. You paid into it. You earned it. Even if you’re an undocumented immigrant. YOU EARNED IT AND IT’S YOURS. Don’t let anybody take it away from you. " False text

column1: theliberaltony 161030552939 "2017-05-24 19:44:02 GMT" http://theliberaltony.tumblr.com/post/161030552939/myn-sii-mcckingbirds-ariana-is-literally-in "myn-sii: mcckingbirds:  ariana is literally in hospital because she’s been in hysterics for 15 hours
column2: has allegedly discussed ending her career and is actively blaming herself for all of this and people are angry for her cancelling her tour?? priorities people
column3: please.  people have lost their lives. families have been separated
column4: an 8 year old girl has just been identified as the second victim. ariana’s whole team actively tried to protect people by taking young kids into safe areas- include her own mother.  this isn’t just a small inconvenience. this is a tragedy. think before you react. i’ve got too many people around me thinking about themselves other than those who deserve and need it.  people still do not consider their idols as human and continue to expect ariana to tour when she’s in pain. it’s sickening. Like
column5: people forget that she’s only 23 years old and was also targeted? This guy picked HER concert
column6: and that’s for to fuck you up.  She heard the screams of the injured and the dying
column7: and she’s actively blaming herself because - in her mind - had she not performed those people might still be alive and well. Ariana and her team worked tirelessly to help the scared
column8: the frightened and the injured. Corralling lost and terrified children backstage and making sure they were safe.  People complaining that “it’s not about her” (well
column10: it was. This person likely wanted someone who was popular enough to draw a big enough crowd and do the most damage)
column11: and how she shouldn’t cancel her tour are heartless monsters. So what if you lose some money? Some parents are coming home to permanently empty beds. Some people have lost limbs. Children had their innocence and childhood ripped away from them far too soon
column12: and will never be free again. And Ariana? She’s probably PETRIFIED of performing again. Wouldn’t you be if someone detonated a BOMB whilst you were working? If someone murdered children at your show?  I think Ariana is incredibly talented and has an amazing range
column13: but will I be sad/angry/frustrated if she cancelled her tour and/or ended her career? No. Because she’s a fucking PERSON who has been through an extremely traumatic event. To those of you moaning and bitching about potential cancellations

column1: theliberaltony 161005747363 "2017-05-24 02:12:13 GMT" http://theliberaltony.tumblr.com/post/161005747363/ive-got-a-dark-side-lotrlocked "ive-got-a-dark-side:  lotrlocked:  get-your-ass-in-the-impala:  smurflewis:  gaysfinest:  Don’t tell your daughter that when a boy is mean or rude to her it’s because he has a crush on her. Don’t teach her that abuse is a sign of love.  My mom always taught me yell or fight back. Boys would be mean and I would yell back. I would get my ass pinched and I would smack them as hard as I could.  Who alway got in trouble? Me.  They would call my mother and she always came in and lectures my teachers and threatened to sue for making her miss work and treating me poorly.  She always taught my brothers to respect women. The only fights my brothers ever got in was defending women from someone else.  The school tried to call my father once instead of my mother on us. He came in in his full preacher outfit (being a preacher and all) and gave them an entire sermon on what would Jesus day of he was called in. They decided dealing with my mom was better.  I think my favorite story of this is when some kid snapped my bra and I turned around
column2: didn’t even think about it
column3: and punched that little motherfucker right in the nose. So naturally
column4: I end up in the principal’s office
column5: refusing to apologize.  “He shouldn’t have put his hands on me and I wouldn’t have hit him!” That’s the only thing I was saying. These people had the unfortunate luck of catching my dad at home
column6: instead of my mom. So he comes fucking sauntering in there
column7: like he’s Clint fucking Eastwood in some western movie and looks at me.  “Melissa
column8: did you punch him?”  “Yes.” I said.  “Why?”  “Because he snapped my bra strap.”  And he turns his squinty eyed glare to the principal and says
column9: “You’re telling me my daughter is in trouble because that squirrely looking kid put his hands on her and she chose to defend herself? That’s what you are saying to me.”  “Well
column10: sir-” The man kind of stuttered because my dad is kind of intimidating in the quiet sort of way that kind of whispers in the back of your mind that this person could be dangerous. “Melissa did make it physical.”  “No. That kid put his hands on my daughter. Are you saying my daughter cannot defend herself when some boy decides to put hands on her? Is that what you are teaching my girl?”  I didn’t get suspended that day.    *slow clap for excellent parenting*  This is the parent I want to be omg " False text

column1: theliberaltony 161004205393 "2017-05-24 01:20:28 GMT" http://theliberaltony.tumblr.com/post/161004205393/comcast-tries-to-censor-pro-net-neutrality-website "sighinastorm: fight4future:  FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
column2: May 23
column5: press@fightforthefuture.org Fight for the Future received a cease and desist order from Comcast’s attorneys for our site Comcastroturf.com. Without net neutrality rules
column6: Comcast could have censored the site outright. Digital rights group Fight for the Future has received a cease and desist order from Comcast’s lawyers
column7: claiming that Comcastroturf.com - a pro-net neutrality site encouraging Internet users to investigate an astroturfing campaign likely funded by the cable lobby - violates Comcast’s “valuable intellectual property.” The letter threatens legal action if the domain is not transferred to Comcast’s control. “This is exactly why we need Title II net neutrality protections that ban blocking
column11: campaign director of Fight for the Future
column13: there would be nothing preventing Comcast from simply blocking sites like Comcastroturf.com that are critical of their corporate policies
column14: ” she added. “It also makes you wonder what Comcast is so afraid of? Are their lobbying dollars funding the astroturfing effort flooding the FCC with fake comments that we are encouraging Internet users to investigate?” The legal notice can be viewed here. It claims that Comcastroturf.com violates the Anticybersquatting Consumer Protection Act and infringes on Comcast’s trademarks. Of course
column16: since the site is clearly a form of First Amendment protected political speech and makes no attempt to impersonate Comcast.  (See the case “Bosley Medical Institute vs. Kremer” which held that sites critical of a company’s practices could not be considered trademark infringement.) Comcastroturf.com encourages Internet users to search the Federal Communication Commission (FCC)’s docket to check if a fake comment was submitted using their name and address to attack Title II based net neutrality protections. It has been widely reported that more than 450
column17: 000 of these comments have been submitted to the FCC – and as a result of the site at Comcastroturf.com
column18: Fight for the Future has heard from dozens of people who say that anti-net neutrality comments were submitted using their personal information without their permission. We have connected individuals with Attorneys Generals and have called for the FCC act immediately to investigate this potential fraud. “Companies like Comcast have a long history of funding shady astroturfing operations like the one we are trying to expose with Comcastroturf.com
column19: and also a long history of engaging in censorship
column21: “this is a perfect example of why we need bright line net neutrality rules that protect our free speech online
column22: and why we can’t just trust Internet Service Providers to behave when they’ve abused their power time and time again.” Fight for the Future has no intention of taking down Comcastroturf.com
column23: and would be happy to discuss the matter with Comcast in court. ###  We keep having to fight the same battle
column25: and these companies just won’t stop trying to get the law changed in their favor
column26: no matter how many times the voting public makes their will known. " False text

column2: but I tell you what
column3: it sure as hell gives you some insight into the mind of the right wing. Example: they started talking about gun control
column4: and how ineffective it is because of all the gun violence out of places like Chicago. “You don’t get that somewhere like Alabama
column5: because everyone knows that everyone carries.” And then they proceed to tell stories of “good ol’ country boys” using those guns to “drive off gangbangers” or “protect a woman’s honor” or whatever. Which leads one to the realization that “gun violence” is only “gun violence” to the right wing when it’s being done by minorities. Alabama could have the most shootings in the nation and it still wouldn’t be “gun violence
column6: ” because that’s just country boys standing up for what’s right when the gub’mint won’t.  That’s literally not at all what that means
column7: but okay  OP is just talking out of their ass.  OP is talking about a conversation he literally had last night. forestwildflower is talking out of their ass.  Sure buddy. You just want to spin this conversation into something about racism
column8: because that’s the cool thing to do these days
column9: right?  Did you actually know that gun rights are for everyone and not just white people? Minorities use guns for protection too! Women use guns for protection! Not just your “good ol’ country boys.”  You know why you don’t get gun violence in places like that? Because criminals are probably less likely to attack someone who they know can and will fight back. It’s not that deep.  Well damn
column10: if I’d realized you were sitting in the car with us I would’ve said hello. Please tell me more about the conversation that I had.  I’m just going to leave this hereSource" False text

column1: theliberaltony 160987239563 "2017-05-23 15:39:16 GMT" http://theliberaltony.tumblr.com/post/160987239563/eleven-things-progressives-can-do "goosedreams333: theliberaltony:  First
column2: recognize what conservatives have done right and where progressives have missed the boat.  It is more than just control of the media
column3: though that is far from trivial. What they have done right is to successfully frame the issues from their perspective. Acknowledge their successes and our failures.  Second
column4: remember “Don’t think of an elephant.” If you keep their language and their framing and just argue against it
column5: you lose because you are reinforcing their frame.  Third
column6: the truth alone will not set you free.  Just speaking truth to power doesn’t work. You need to frame the truths effectively from your perspective.  Fourth
column7: you need to speak from your moral perspective at all times. Progressive policies follow from progressive values. Get clear on your values and use the language of values. Drop the language of policy wonks.  Fifth
column8: understand where conservatives are coming from.  Get their strict father morality and its consequences clear. Know what you are arguing against. Be able to explain why they believe what they believe. Try to predict what they will say.  Sixth
column10: across issue areas.  Think in terms of large moral goals
column11: not in terms of programs for their own sake.  Seventh
column12: think about the consequences of proposals.  Form progressive slippery slope initiatives.  Eighth
column13: remember that voters vote their identity and their values
column14: which need not coincide with their self-interest.  Ninth
column15: unite! And cooperate!  Here’s how: Remember the six modes of progressive thought: (1) socioeconomic
column20: and (6) antiauthoritarian. Notice which of these modes of thought you use most often-where you fall on the spectrum and where the people you talk to fall on the spectrum. Then rise above your own mode of thought and start thinking and talking from shared progressive values.  Tenth
column25: on every issue. Don’t just say what you believe. Use your frames
column26: not their frames. Use them because they fit the values you believe in.  Eleventh
column27: speak to the progressive base in order to activate the nurturant model of “swing voters.”  Don’t move to the right. Rightward movement hurts in two ways. It alienates the progressive base and it helps conservatives by activating their model in swing voters.  -George Lakoff  true
column28: there are a lot of mistakes that leftists are making when communicating with the right  This isn’t about communicating with the right. You will never change the minds of the right wing
column29: this is about communicating with the American Public in general. As you could see in this most recent election
column30: there are many people that will never vote for the Democrat
column31: no matter how toxic the Republican candidate is. On the other hand
column32: 43% of the voting population are “Independent Voters” (there are many articles outlining how they are not really independent
column33: but in general they do not vote for only one party even though they may tend to vote for one party more often than the other)These are the people that are needed to be convinced that your policies will work for them. They are willing to vote for either party even if they tend to vote primarily in one direction. This is who you are messaging to
column34: not the right wing. The problem with the Democratic party is that they have messaged to the right
column35: in trying to pick up those voters and it doesn’t work. They don’t want to hear that you support the other parties policies
column36: that just shows them they should vote for the other party (why buy generic when you can afford the brand name). They want to see why your policies will work for them
column37: not that you want the same policies as the other side. " False text

column1: theliberaltony 160956935192 "2017-05-22 19:31:09 GMT" http://theliberaltony.tumblr.com/post/160956935192/stillstreetjoshua-bpdzoldyck-as-someone-who "stillstreetjoshua: bpdzoldyck:  As someone who has been living with severe suicidal ideation my entire life I wanna tell you all something
column2: you don’t have to stay alive for yourself. People will say it’s a bad idea to live for external things because they’re temporary
column3: and it’s true living for yourself is ideal but if you’re not to that point yet that’s ok too.  I’ve lived for my dog for the past 4 years
column4: before that I lived for my snakes
column5: before that I lived for my cat. You can live for whatever needs you and whatever matters to you. Live for your best friend
column8: live for your animal crossing town. Live for whatever keeps you alive and the day will come when you can live for yourself.  This is something everyone should see. Thank you for sharing this. " False text

column1: theliberaltony 160994898745 "2017-05-23 20:09:51 GMT" http://theliberaltony.tumblr.com/post/160994898745/billy-bush-on-notorious-trump-tape-it-wasnt "politico: The infamous “Access Hollywood” tape on which President Donald Trump can be heard describing in vulgar detail how his celebrity allowed him to sexually assault women with impunity was not “locker room talk
column2: ” as then-candidate Trump suggested
column3: according to the other man on the tape
column5: who was fired from his job on NBC’s “Today” show shortly after the tape’s publication last October
column6: described in an interview published over the weekend by The Hollywood Reporter how the 2005 tape derailed his career and led to months of reflection that included a week-long stay at a self-help retreat in California. theliberaltony 160961605346 "2017-05-22 21:53:26 GMT" http://theliberaltony.tumblr.com/post/160961605346/have-you-ever-wondered-how-much-energy-you-put-in "lavenderenergy:  A recent article offering men advice about how to proposition a woman wearing headphones – encouraging them to block her path to prevent her from ignoring them – rightfully provoked a major backlash. But the backlash also brought a certain phenomenon to wider public attention – the fact that women sometimes wear headphones as a way to avoid unwanted approaches in public. The public conversation on violence against women tends to focus on sexual assault and domestic abuse. We talk less about the routine intrusions women experience from men in their everyday lives
column2: even though this is the most common form of sexual violence. " False link
